abstract_summ: In this work, we propose a multitask deep learning model to jointly identify COVID-19 patient and segment COVID-19 lesion from chest CT images.On the other hand, fast training/testing and low computational cost are also important for quick deployment and development of computer-aided COVID-19 screening systems, but traditional deep learning methods, especially for image segmentation, are usually computationally intensive.To the best of the authors' knowledge, COVID-Net is one of the first open source network designs for COVID-19 detection from CXR images at the time of initial release.By no means a production-ready solution, the hope is that the open access COVID-Net, along with the description on constructing the open source COVIDx dataset, will be leveraged and build upon by both researchers and citizen data scientists alike to accelerate the development of highly accurate yet practical deep learning solutions for detecting COVID-19 cases and accelerate treatment of those who need it the most.However, the publicly available COVID-19 training data are limited, which would easily cause overfitting of traditional deep learning methods that are usually data-hungry with millions of parameters.
title_summ: An Extremely Minimum Network for Efficient COVID-19 SegmentationDeep Learning COVID-19 Features on CXR using Limited Training Data SetsDiagnosing COVID-19 Pneumonia from X-Ray and CT Images using Deep Learning and Transfer Learning AlgorithmsExtracting Possibly Representative COVID-19 Biomarkers from X-ray Images with Deep Learning Approach and Image Data Related to Pulmonary DiseasesMulti-task Deep Learning Based CT Imaging Analysis For COVID-19: Classification and SegmentationEXPLAINABLE-BY-DESIGN APPROACH FOR COVID-19 CLASSIFICATION VIA CT-SCANFinding Covid-19 from Chest X-rays using Deep Learning on a Small DatasetConvolutional Sparse Support Estimator Based Covid-19 Recognition from X-ray ImagesMomentum Contrastive Learning for Few-Shot COVID-19 Diagnosis from Chest CT ImagesCOVID-Net:Deep Learning COVID-19 Features on CXR using Limited Training Data Sets.A Tailored Deep Convolutional Neural Network Design for Detection of COVID-19 Cases from Chest X-Ray ImagesMiniSeg:
title_abstract_phrases: In this work, we propose a multitask deep learning model to jointly identify COVID-19 patient and segment COVID-19 lesion from chest CT images.Code and models will be released to promote the research and practical deployment for computer-aided COVID-19 screening.On the other hand, fast training/testing and low computational cost are also important for quick deployment and development of computer-aided COVID-19 screening systems, but traditional deep learning methods, especially for image segmentation, are usually computationally intensive.EXPLAINABLE-BY-DESIGN APPROACH FOR COVID-19 CLASSIFICATION VIA CT-SCANThe COVID-19 disease has widely spread all over the world since the beginning of 2020.Deep Learning COVID-19 Features on CXR using Limited Training Data Sets.
